_header: Son let not idleness you enslumber
Subjects: instructions; children, instructions for the behavior of
_description: Counsels by a father and mother — two 4-line stanzas

BodAsh52.Transcription:
Son lett not ydelnesse ȝou enslombreNor wydnesse of clothys
                    ȝou encombre[ ] ȝour loue precious put ȝour reflygth[ ]
                    reward ȝou as it is rygth
BodAsh52.Editions:
Brotanek,  Rudolph. 
             Mittelenglische Dichtungen aus der Handschrift 432 des Trinity College
                in Dublin.
         Halle: Niemeyer, 1940: 49.
Black,  William Henry. 
             Catalogi Codicum Manuscriptorum Bibliothecae Bodleianae…Pars X,
                A…Catalogue of the Manuscripts bequeathed…by Elias Ashmole.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1845: 91.

CamTCC652.First Lines:
Dere s[ ] let not ydelnes yow enslombreNe wydenes of clothes you
                    encombre…
CamTCC652.Last Lines:
…Ne lat nat youre yen be nettys of your careffor aftyr ryot
                    sone comythe evyll fare
CamTCC652.Editions:
Brotanek,  Rudolph. 
             Mittelenglische Dichtungen aus der Handschrift 432 des Trinity College
                in Dublin.
         Halle: Niemeyer, 1940: 49.
Mustanoja,  Tauno F. 
             How the Good Wife Taught her Daughter, etc.
         Helsinki: Suomalaisen Kirjallisuuden Scuran, 1948: 72-3.
